00006 //! \brief Store for primative matrix information.
00007 //! \author Lee Netherton
00008 //!
00009 //! The MatrixContainer class is used to store the matrix data. It holds
00010 //! a pointer to the data array, and also the size of the matrix. Each
00011 //! matrix will have a pointer to a matrix container within it.
00012 //!
00013 class MatrixContainer
00014 {
00015         private:
00016 
00017                 //! Number of rows
00018                 unsigned int m_rows;
00019 
00020                 //! Number of columns
00021                 unsigned int m_columns;
00022 
00023                 //! Pointer to data array
00024                 double *m_data;
00025 
00026         public:
00027 
00028                 //! \brief Sized constructor
00029                 //!
00030                 //! To create a MatrixContainer with appropriate values.
00031                 //! \param data Pointer to data array. Assigned to \a m_data.
00032                 //! \param rows Number of rows. Assigned to \a m_rows.
00033                 //! \param columns Number of columns. Assigned to \a m_columns.
00034                 MatrixContainer(const double * data, const unsigned int rows, const unsigned int columns) : m_data((double *)data), m_rows(rows), m_columns(columns)
00035                 {
00036                         #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCTOR
00037                                 printf("Constructor: MatrixContainer(const double * data, const unsigned int rows, const unsigned int columns)\n");
00038                         #endif
00039                 }
00040 
00041                 //! \brief Copy constructor
00042                 //!
00043                 //! To create a MatrixContainer from a copy of another
00044                 //! \param copy Reference to container to copy
00045                 MatrixContainer(const MatrixContainer& copy) : m_data(copy.getDataPointer()), m_rows(copy.getRows()), m_columns(copy.getColumns())
00046                 {
00047                         #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCTOR
00048                                 printf("Constructor: MatrixContainer(const MatrixContainer& copy)\n");
00049                         #endif
00050                 }
00051 
00052                 // --------- Get/Set functions --------------------
00053 
00054                 //! \brief Returns the number of rows
00055                 unsigned int getRows() const {return m_rows;}
00056 
00057                 //! \brief Retuens the number of columns
00058                 unsigned int getColumns() const {return m_columns;}
00059 
00060                 //! \brief Returns the data pointer
00061                 virtual double * getDataPointer() const {return m_data;}
00062 
00063                 //! \brief Sets the number of rows
00064                 void setRows(unsigned int num) {m_rows = num;}
00065 
00066                 //! \brief Sets the number of columns
00067                 void setColumns(unsigned int num) {m_columns = num;}
00068 
00069                 //! \brief Sets the data pointer
00070                 void setDataPointer(const double * ptr) {m_data = (double *)ptr;}
00071 };

00073 //! \brief Store for SubMatrix information.
00074 //! \author Lee Netherton
00075 //!
00076 //! The SubMatrixContainer class is used to store the sub matrix data
00077 //! as well as the usual matrix data. It holds
00078 //! a pointer to the original matrix's container, and also the
00079 //! start and end positions for the sub matrix with respect to
00080 //! the original.
00081 //!
00082 class SubMatrixContainer : public MatrixContainer
00083 {
00084         private:
00085 
00086                 // --------- Sub matrix members ----------------
00087 
00088                 //! Pointer to the original matrix's container
00089                 const MatrixContainer * m_originalContainer;
00090 
00091                 //! Start position for rows
00092                 unsigned int m_rowStart;
00093 
00094                 //! End position for rows
00095                 unsigned int m_rowEnd;
00096 
00097                 //! Start position for columns
00098                 unsigned int m_columnStart;
00099 
00100                 //! End position for columns
00101                 unsigned int m_columnEnd;
00102 
00103         public:
00104                 //! \brief Basic constructor
00105                 //!
00106                 //! To create a SubMatrixContainer from an original MatrixContainer
00107                 //! and start and end values for the rows and columns.
00108                 //! \param original Pointer to the original matrix's container
00109                 //! \param rowStart The starting row for the submatrix
00110                 //! \param rowEnd The finishing row for the submatrix
00111                 //! \param columnStart The starting column for the submatrix
00112                 //! \param columnEnd The finishing column for the submatrix
00113                 SubMatrixContainer(const MatrixContainer * original, unsigned int rowStart, unsigned int rowEnd, unsigned int columnStart, unsigned int columnEnd) :
00114                         MatrixContainer(original->getDataPointer(), (rowEnd-rowStart)+1, (columnEnd-columnStart)+1),
00115                         m_rowStart(rowStart), m_rowEnd(rowEnd), m_columnStart(columnStart), m_columnEnd(columnEnd),
00116                         m_originalContainer(original)
00117                         {
00118                                 #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCTOR
00119                                         printf("Constructor: SubMatrixContainer(MatrixContainer * original, int rowStart, int rowEnd, int columnStart, int columnEnd)\n");
00120                                 #endif
00121                         }
00122 
00123                 //! \brief Copy constructor
00124                 //!
00125                 //! To create a SubMatrixContainer from a copy of another
00126                 //! \param copy Reference to SubMatrixContainer to copy
00127                 SubMatrixContainer(const SubMatrixContainer& copy) :
00128                         MatrixContainer(copy.m_originalContainer->getDataPointer(), copy.getRows(), copy.getColumns()),
00129                         m_rowStart(copy.getRowStart()), m_rowEnd(copy.getRowEnd()), m_columnStart(copy.getColumnStart()), m_columnEnd(copy.getColumnEnd()),
00130                         m_originalContainer(copy.m_originalContainer)
00131                         {
00132                                 #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCTOR
00133                                         printf("Constructor: SubMatrixContainer(SubMatrixContainer& copy)\n");
00134                                 #endif
00135                         }
00136 
00137 
00138                 // -------- SubMatrix functions ----------------------------
00139 
00140                 //! Resurns a pointer to the original matrix's MatrixContainer
00141                 const MatrixContainer * getOrigPointer() const {return m_originalContainer;}
00142 
00143                 //! \brief Returns the number of rows in the original container
00144                 unsigned int getRowsOrig() const {return m_originalContainer->getRows();}
00145 
00146                 //! \brief Returns the number of rows in the original container
00147                 unsigned int getColumnsOrig() const {return m_originalContainer->getColumns();}
00148 
00149                 //! \brief Returns the row start position
00150                 unsigned int getRowStart() const {return m_rowStart;}
00151 
00152                 //! \brief Returns the row end position
00153                 unsigned int getRowEnd() const {return m_rowEnd;}
00154 
00155                 //! \brief Returns the column start position
00156                 unsigned int getColumnStart() const {return m_columnStart;}
00157 
00158                 //! \brief Returns the column end position
00159                 unsigned int getColumnEnd() const {return m_columnEnd;}
00160 
00161                 //! \brief Sets the row start position
00162                 void setRowStart(const unsigned int num) {m_rowStart = num;}
00163 
00164                 //! \brief Sets the row end position
00165                 void setRowEnd(const unsigned int num) {m_rowEnd = num;}
00166 
00167                 //! \brief Sets the column start position
00168                 void setColumnStart(const unsigned int num) {m_columnStart = num;}
00169 
00170                 //! \brief Sets the column end position
00171                 void setColumnEnd(const unsigned int num) {m_columnEnd = num;}
00172 
00173 };
